title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
custom_summary: A haunting tale of wealth, ambition, and lost love set in the Jazz Age. Jay Gatsby throws extravagant parties in pursuit of the elusive Daisy Buchanan, while narrator Nick Carraway watches the drama unfold from his modest cottage next door.
discussion_prompts: How does Fitzgerald use the green light as a symbol throughout the novel?
Is Gatsby a sympathetic character, or is he deluded? Why?
How does the setting of the 1920s shape the characters' values and choices?
What does Nick's role as narrator reveal about the nature of storytelling?
Is the 'American Dream' still relevant today? How does the novel critique it?
